intro: Leucas nubica, commonly known as the cloud leucas, is a herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Leucas nubica is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
